title: Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, great people! I felt that everyone genuinely wanted to find a good fit. The power balance felt healthy. I was first contacted by the HR manager. The next stage of the process is to be interviewed by the team if my application is selected.
Interview Questions: - How has your experience prepared you to take on this role?

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring managers were very professional. I went through 2 interview stages and they got back to me to give me updates after each interview process. Interview 1 was by phone and interview 2 was in the office.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Undergrad Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the professor you have previously reached out to by email, he asked some questions about previous experience and the technologies you have used before. Was a 20 min Zoom call.
Interview Questions: What languages have you used?

title: Ph.D. Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Short introduction, followed by basic technical knowledge in this field, and advanced parts related to the professor's field. The total interview lasts around 30-1hr. Suggestions on reading more to the professor's topic before interview.
Interview Questions: Short introduction, followed by basic technical knowledge in this field, and advanced parts related to the professor's field.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Ottawa, ON) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: They Sent me and email, wanted to talk on the phone interview was done by zoom on telephone they asked me questions and I answered I told them about myself and talked about what I would bring.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Environmental Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, helped give experience for future interviews as a student and gave me confidence knowing what kind of questions would be asked in an interview, overall very good experience
Interview Questions: What makes your previous experience applicable to this job

title: Digital Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews: HR, on teams, in-person. HR one took half an hour, on teams was about 45 minutes, the in-person one was about an hour. There was also a writing test, which was surprisingly difficult.
Interview Questions: Getting someone to donate more.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Apply via the form below and tell us a bit about you. Complete the online assessment (we’ll send you a link by email). Complete the interviews with our friendly talent team over phone and video. Lastly, you’ll interview with one or more of our clients.
Interview Questions: What motivates me in software development?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the Masters of Management in Analytics program. The interview went smoothly. The program director was friendly and encouraging. The interview was focused on gauging my skills in technical, analytical and business acumen.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with programming languages and the use cases to which you applied them.

title: Industry Liaison Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through an employee referral online. Was then called for a screening interview to confirm salary expectations. After that, I was invited to a one hour Zoom interview, followed by a second Zoom interview to assess fit. Both Zoom interviews were very warm and friendly and gave me an accurate perception of the office.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why are you interested in this role, what kind of environment do you thrive working in?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview. I had an online interview with an interviewer, she described what a tutor should do and asked if I had any questions. Nothing difficult, It took about 15 min.
Interview Questions: What should you do if someone misses your meeting?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very unstructured, and all over the place with many separate interviews. And then I just never heard from them. I interviewed with no clear hierarchical order so it was very misleading
Interview Questions: They asked me a lot vague questions about my past jobs but with no apparent context

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple questions on previous work experience. Case study on a new business startup. Had multiple rounds, one with the HR, another with a team member before the final meeting with the hiring manager
Interview Questions: What is the most challenging project you worked on?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Had a 10 min screening call and then interviewed on zoom several days later. The interview was about an hour long. Most questions were behavioral ones. Interviewers were nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process involved meeting with office to discuss role and my experience. The interview took approximately thirty to forty minutes . 

Also had to submit CV and cover letter.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in the research area?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process only took one round for roughly 30 minutes. It felt that anything below 30 minutes would be consider a lack of interest from the interviewer. The interview was quick, relevant, educative, and welcoming. The offer was out in 1 week or so.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. Where do you see yourself in the next 2 years? Do you understand what you are going to do in this position? Why do you mention this [...] in your cover letter? Do you have any question for us?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
My interview process was the following: 
I first sent my resume and cover letter through their platform. Then I was contacted for a 30-minute interview with a manager by zoom.
Interview Questions:
The first question was about describing the role I was applying for.
Then mostly behavioural questions. Tell me a time when you deal with a bad client, a time when you showed leadership...

title: Reaseach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Interview in person with researcher, who reviewed resume. Great overall - Fair and rigorous process that was objective in nature, and showed that they cared about my personal and professional goals.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the documents on workday website, I received a phone call asking about my availability to do a virtual interview on zoom. HR representative and a manager from that faculty were doing the interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal manager. How do you deal with difficult students. What do you do under pressure/while stressed?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview. 2 interviewers. general questions about interest in the field and the university as well as your general background. clinical situations where they assess your reasoning. The make you feel at ease. You do not feel pressure, they are very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want McGill ?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple, once I sent an email with CV, I was promptly replied with options for interview times and was automatically set up for a zoom call at my selected time.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment was I most proud of?

title: McGill Sports Camp Sports Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: super causal, answered every day questions to get your personality, and also did a creativity test by giving us one item like a ball and we have to come up with a game or challenge
Interview Questions:
1. What is your favourite movie? 
2. What is your favourite book?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: 3 15 min interviews back to back, the first one is the general interview. the second one is about music, the last one is a technical interview. it was very simple
Interview Questions: difference between put and post

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Four interviews and a test for a relatively low end job, including one with the VP! It was an off-putting experience  and gave me an early impression of the top-down hierarchical culture.
Interview Questions: What did you do to prepare for this interview?

title: Systems Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Good Interview aligned to JD. Pleasant interview environment, casual and relaxed. Three people on the interview panel, remote via WebEx. Asked clear business case questions, with real world scenarios. Good experience overall.
Interview Questions: What was my professional background

title: Human Resources Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of virtual interviews followed by a reference check. The first round was more about your experience and the second round had more technical and situational questions. I found it a bit more intimidating when the second round had 4 interviewers.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our unit?

title: Remote Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: No Interview which was quite nice! Heard back in a week. Transition was also very smooth and well organised. They had several meetings set up for different time zones so it was accessible to everyone and also had a discussion forum etc.
Interview Questions: No question, just submitted my CV

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
There were Three people. They were all very nice.
10 questions that ask basic things about skills organization and a few situations like how to deal with a difficult customer.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your time?

title: Project Manager Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: This is a 3 step process. HR screening over the phone, meeting the project manager in person. The HR and the team are both very professional. After the 1-hr interview with the project manager, HR called me that told me that they can't offer me the position because I don't speak french.
Interview Questions:
How do you describe yourself?
Do you speak French?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I discussed the possibility of joining the lab that I was working at for my graduate work with my supervisor and my supervisor said that he would be happy to take me on.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to stay at the lab? What projects will you be working on?

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: easygoing, was interviewed by 2 members of the welcome center office, asked about why i wanted to be a tour guide, my knowledge of campus/activities on campus, communication skills, etc. very relaxed and whole thing took ~30 minutes
Interview Questions: How are you involved on campus

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
My experience with their Senior Technical Talent manager was very good She was professional and nice, but the human resource who managed the initial interview was really pushy and unprofessional!
They approached me first, I already was working somewhere, they had permanent and term openings for IT functional analyst and the HR lady tried to push me to go with the Term one.. I said I’d rather not since I was already permanent.. she sounded not happy!
I saw another posting weeks later, talked to the senior talent manager again and she said she will schedule a call.. days later I received a call from the same HR lady without any notice! a day before Christmas!! 
I was in the middle of packing my luggage to go away for Christmas , this is how unannounced the call was! the call took 30 seconds! she asked me if I ever worked with HR systems before I said not specifically.. she quickly said ok then I’ll call you if anything else matches! 
as if she just wanted to cross my name off the list because she was told to contact me!! 
who start the interview like that? what type of a dead-end question is that?
I found it very unprofessional and did not consider there anymore for working..
Interview Questions: Have you worked with HR systems before?!

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, I just met with the supervisor to see if the role would be a fit. They previously emailed me directly, offering the role. Very straightforward and quite enjoyable.
Interview Questions: How will you use this experience moving forward?

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I went through two rounds of interviews; one with an HR manager and one with the Dean of the faculty. The interviews (over zoom) were friendly and professional, but I found they asked a lot of specific problem solving questions that felt a bit like working for free (especially when I didn’t get the offer).
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you had to respond to a high stress situation?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 panel interviews, they ask some questions in French to assess your language. Work is entirely in English but French is required. There was also a word and excel written test which was easy.
Interview Questions:
-Tell me about yourself
-What describes the ideal manager from your perspective

title: Procurement Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very technical (memorize your procurement text book) due to the stringent selection process.  It seemed though they are looking for for someone who already has at least 2-3years background in procurement experience judging from the seriousness of their questions.  Even though the interviewers  in this department don’t seem to have official procurement/supply chain academics credentials, but they have the necessary experience in the subject matter....
Interview Questions: What is the typical procurement  cycle?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Resume sent online first and then requested to have an interview - which had a few questions on interest, skills, and applicability as asked by an employee at the Welcome Centre.
Interview Questions: 1) Why do you want to be a Student Ambassador?

title: Account Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and seemed to betray a lack of agreement among the decision makers. Unwilling to make a timely decision. Perhaps a matter of unresolved internal politics. I gave up -- life is too short to wait for a group of eggheads to come to an agreement.
Interview Questions: Do you write in French?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Application and interview process was simple and easy, I was reached out by a professor to work with him and I had to choose between that position and another project I was interested in.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this project?

title: Student Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the website. Fill in relevant details on the portal and you will be notified if they are interested in recruiting you to a position. They may ask additional questions.
Interview Questions: How long have you been coding for?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
- Emailed my professor of interest 4 months before the application deadline and told keep in touch.
- Re-emailed the professor 1 month before the deadline
- Interviewed by the professor
- Allowed to apply
Interview Questions:
- Why choose to work with me?
- What is your research interest?
- What are your research skills?
- Do you have any questions for me?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: one round interview, ask questions about what listed on CV. Tech questions about data structure, design pattern, write code for a question and do an explanation. some concepts in java, mainly around what listed on CV
Interview Questions: implement a linked list in java.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR. After that, you get contacted for a first in person and then another one with director and manager. Interviews are all behavioural, very standard. Got offer about a week later
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you went above and beyond your role

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Asked past project. Algorithm. Design pattern. Stack and heap.  Linked list. Question can be found on internet. White board desciption. Not diffcult. Make sure you can explain your cv well.
Interview Questions: Design pattern. Linked list. Dedign pattern

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
No interview just need to send CV 
Has to be an enrolled McGill student who has relevant experience in the related course. It's better to be a graduate student in the application process
Interview Questions: No interview send the CV

title: Senior Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with different groups of people including the managing director, direct boss and direct reports. Interview was fairly standard though I did appreciate meeting my direct reports during the process.
Interview Questions: How I juggled multiple priorities

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Tasks include maintaining and expanding on the Lydon lab's Public website, developing software necessary for various research projects (often online), and helping with research related computer maintenance and troubleshooting as needed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: discuss work you do, read your resume, and discuss your ambitions, targets, what research part do you like. any other things you can think of, basically a chat with a professor, research assistant, in class
Interview Questions: what do you find it ambitious

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Got an email for an interview. Easy interview,  basic questions. Nothing technical, behavioural questions and potential scenarios presented to combat. Interviewer was very nice, and worked well. Over all a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to tutor? What courses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
Not very stringent 
They focus mostly on research work, detailing the outcome and contribution.
The panel is very fair and friendly. They ask the questions right from the elementary schools till under graduate. Focusing on why you are interested in research.
Interview Questions: General questions on research

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed HR and my potential supervisor in the first interview, was asked questions in a very informal manner and relaxing manner. I then had a follow-up second interview. Was a very stress-free process and everyone was super understanding. They asked questions about my experience and how well suited I would be for the position.
Interview Questions: How does your work experience translate to this job?

title: Staffing Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
First phone screen with team leader followed by an in-person interview with some members of the team.

Straightforward experience, a mix of HR questions and scenarios. A quick question to test French proficiency. 

The process was overall pleasant and timely with a good explanation of the role.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your workload?

title: Human Resources Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were many interviewers present at the interview. They asked me many behavioral-based questions. Testing was also administered. I found the interview very difficult and long. It was also very formal.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by HR. Three to  one. HR + hiring manager + staff member. They took turns asking questions. 
45 minute interview (behavioral + judgement call) + presentation
Interview Questions: Typical - tell me about yourself and what brought you to apply for this role?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: The correspondence starts by an email exchange first, and then it is usually followed by an arranged skype chat with prospective supervisor. And then there is usually further email correspondence to discuss research topics etc. After that the candidate may be asked to make a presentation to the research group he or she is planning to join.  The presentation is fairly informal and you get some questions from the attendees. Finally the candidate will discuss financial situation and the expected duration of the candidacy, and some preliminary research plan.
Interview Questions: What kind of research topics are you interested in?

title: Master Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I'd recommend meeting with a prospective professor a few months in advance and seeing if they are willing to take you on as a graduate student. It's a fairly informal process overall. It generally helps if you've taken a course with the professor and done well in their class. I'd also suggest reading some of their most recent publications to get a sense of what they do.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the research that we do in this lab?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got an phone call after almost 4 weeks when I applied for the job online. two steps interview: a phone interview and then a face-to-face interview. For the phone interview, the HR asked me some general questions and told me there would be an interview the next week.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself/ why did you leave your last job? /why choose mcgill

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I met with my professor maybe four times to determine which research projects were open. You might need to be persistent in order to land an actual research job, but there are often things open if you look hard enough.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: It went really well. There were two people interviewing me: one professor responsible for scientific and technical questions, the other from HR. The questions from HR were easy and standard. The questions from the professor were thought provoking questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab? What did you learn from your Ph.D? What is your weakness and strength?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked technical and non technical questions for a software developer. They asked normal questions to talk about the resume and then when i finished talking about the resume they asked me alot of technical javascrip questions. They were looking for a front end developer
Interview Questions: how does javascript concatination work

title: Floor Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the online application, which includes 2 short answers and 1 cover letter, all applicants are notified of the interview on the coming weekend. The duration was 1.5 hrs in total. There were 2 rounds,
Interview Questions: What relationship would you like to build with your floor?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The professor asks for transcript and CV and what we would be interested in doing and then the interview is about 30 min in her office. Focus on studying her lab and research and learn some technical skills
Interview Questions: What interests you about our lab

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Quebec, QC)
Interview Descriptions: The professor was kind and appreciated my research background and asked me to describe how my experience here was so far, he asked me about my interests and gave me options to select a project
Interview Questions: What are your short term and long term plans

title: Course Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a HR and 2 profs. The HR asked most questions and the profs gave information about the job and asked some more technical questions. They were friendly and a bit tough some times.
Interview Questions: We think you can do this job, but since you are overqualified we are afraid you will leave the position soon after you take it because you will realize you can make more money in the industry. (Be prepared to answer this statement if you are overqualified).

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: the interview was one-hour long, with general questions and scenario questions. Two people interviewed me and they took turns to ask questions. The atmosphere was very friendly, and we even laughed together for a couple times.
Interview Questions:
How do you define "health"?
what's your past experience like?
What you think you can bring to the team?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got an internship through the Arts Internship Program. I went in for an initial interview with the AIO managers which lasted around 10 minutes - asked me basic questions about my CV and past experience. I was called in for a second interview which they said would be 10-15 minutes but lasted 30 minutes, this interview was more in-depth.
Interview Questions: They asked me about specific course work I had done, how I would handle a day on the job, etc.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed directly with the PhD supervisor, and then the research group. The interviews were conducted over Skype.  Once I was accepted by the supervisor, I applied to the graduate program
Interview Questions: What are your qualifications for this position?

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: the interview involved a group presentation of my previous work and 1-to-1 chat with senior lab members and staffs. and another 30-minute talk with the principal investigator. The group member was nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: Why you would like to work in the lab?

title: Casual Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. This position is offered to qualified candidates who show an interest in the lab's research and make a good rapport with the PI. If the PI decides to pay you, you'll be given this position and paid from a research grant.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: went in for interview with three people (2 HR, 1 hiring manager). asked a bunch of situational questions. I got called back to do a super basic test which i had to have passed with flying colours (had to write two emails and draft a letter of offer).  I still haven't heard back. so disorganized I am really unimpressed.
Interview Questions: Why would someone not want to work with you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: About 20 minutes in their department, then a 40 minutes computer test following. The total time taken was about 1 hour. The interviewers were very friendly and the questions were quite clear.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self; Why do you think you are the right fit; Give me an example that shows your creative.

title: Alumni Relations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: There is a phone interview, then a meeting with HR, then senior management and then you find out if you are hired. This usually takes 3 weeks. The process can take awhile but it's worth it.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for a university

title: Alumni Relations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First HR screens you via phone, you may have two phone calls. 

You are asked to do an in person test. Generally it’s a writing test to assess your knowledge of McGill and your ability to write to donors on behalf of the university.

Then HR will invite you for an interview where you are asked questions about your fit for the role.

Then you will interview with the director of the department.
Interview Questions: What is your knowledge of donor relations in higher education?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: short chat of about 5-10 min about job responsibilities & simulation of a call. entire interview took about 30 min. pretty chill, not very stressful. kinda hard to screw up, most questions were pretty obvious in the answer they were looking for
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: A one on one round with 3 managers. Lots of behavioral, focus on showing you researched other interns and why they were good at what they did. Show good teamwork/autonomy. The managers were very nice, and pressed me on some of my experiences. If you do well, you will be able to stay on full time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you were a leader?

title: Graduate Reaesrch Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews, it was intense, I met with graduate students first before meeting with the supervisor at the end. I was also required to give a presentation about my research experience prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: Mostly questions related to my research, future goals and funding.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted professors by email, then set a time to meet and speak with them in person for an hour. Visited the lab and talked to the other students in the lab. After some time, the professor got back to me with their decision whether or not they were willing to take on another graduate student for the following school year.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a part of my lab?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: HR made a short phone interview and then they invited me to a second interview with hiring manager and hr. They were very nice and comforting. HR asked regular behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: what will be the biggest difficulty in this position for you

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: No specific interview. I was a PhD student under the same person, so there was no need for any interview whatsoever. Usually I think it will go through a selection process and the Professor will decide on who he or she wants to talk to
Interview Questions: Knowledge of mechanics and research experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes Skype meeting in the first place, then arranged the interview including: visit lab, scientific presentation about previous research projects and individual meeting with lab members. Asked for references afterwards
Interview Questions: Why interested and how you can contribute

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via email. I was contacted to schedule a phone interview the same week. The phone interview lasted about an hour and I was asked very technical and specific questions in regards to my resume and experience. During my phone interview I was asked to schedule an in-person interview for the following week and to bring a list references with me which I thought was a good sign.  The in-person interview seemed a bit archaic to me. The recruiter asked me a series of "describe a time when...." questions and recorded what I was saying on paper. After that I did an excel test in another room. The recruiter had told me the next step would be an interview with the person I would be reporting to and  she would get back to me by the end of the week. Friday came and I heard nothing. I waited for the following week to contact her but she didn't acknowledge my email. Finally she called me the next Friday to say that things had changed and they were still deciding and that she would get back to me the following week. Again, the next week came and went and I still heard nothing. I once again had to contact the recruiter since I knew the office would be closed for the holidays but I never got a response. Finally, a month after my in-person interview the recruiter contacted me to tell me that they would not move forward with my candidacy. Overall the interview process was very disorganized and it was frustrating to have been asked for references so early in the hiring process if they weren't going to use them.
Interview Questions: How do you use your analytical skills in your current position?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy process in which they asked me my schedule, if I was okay with tedious work, and any previous experience. Was offered the job on the spot and accepted.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted the professor whom I was interested to work with via email. I sent my resume and wrote about my thesis in PhD. Professor replied to my email and set a meeting to meet in person. Had meeting with the professor at Chemical Engineering department and discussed some ideas that I was interested to work on.
Interview Questions: Presented what I did during my PhD

title: Lease Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: One in-person interview that relates to my skills and ability to take on the job at hand. Since this was a new role, I was asked how I would shape the role the better help the department.
Interview Questions: How would you organize the leases?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview is quite formal. One hr and two staff from the department. They asked questions on the list, one by one, and they took notes on my answers. The last question is on French.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer and the Head of Human Resources were in a room across from me. I was asked personality as well as technical questions regarding the my previous workplace. The interview took place over the long span of ninety minutes. The interviewers were quite professional and pleasant, as well.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my CV and cover letter via email, after which they called me in for an interview. I was interviewed jointly by an HR representative and my supervisor. A few days later they called me to offer me the job and to set up a start date. There was a bit of a delay in providing me with the formal letter of offer , which put me in a bit of a stressful situation in resigning from my old job, but it eventually worked out.
Interview Questions: How do I manage my time? Do I ever leave tasks unattended till the end of the week?

title: Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Cookie cutter interview, with prepared questions, people writing a lot on a notepad but not very responsive personally, "stone-faced" and impartial. Hard to know how you did until you get an answer. There were 3 people in the room and only one of them was talking to me. One person was on their laptop the whole time.
Interview Questions: "Describe a conflict situation at your previous job and how you handled it."

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: simple hiring and interview process. 1:1 interview process. Asked questions about previous work experience. Met with senior principal investigator then with research coordinator. Basically a summary of CV, and then a few questions about problem  solving and conflict resolution
Interview Questions: generic questions about CV and previous research experience

title: Casual Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
graduate casual research assistant, conducting literature reviews
After sending my CV and cover letter, I got an examination on reading and summarizing an article related to their research project. After submitting the answers,  a phone interview was conducted.
Interview Questions: summarize the article, list their findings, the methodology?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online with a cover letter and resume, then around week after, I received the in-person interview from the professor. We start with some basic question about my background and qualification, and then my Ph. D research and understanding of current project.
Interview Questions: why you thought you will be good fit to this position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The HR person was very nice. She gave all the details related to the job. The head of department gave all the details related of the department. At the end of the intreview I really didnt have to ask questions. 
The interview was held in a vey old fashioned way, so I lost the concentration thinking: really? They still ask these questions these days?
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview as my supervisor was already familiar with my work since I had been working with him for some time. As for informal interview, the job was handed to me based on performance appraisal of my previous research work. Prior to this process, my supervisor asked me some mathematical question(s) on linear algebra.
Interview Questions: As I said in the interview process, I was mainly evaluated based on my past performance.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a required position to take as part of the graduate program, so there was not really a interview process, but to get into graduate school you must have the minimum required GPA for that year to get in, I believe you had to submit a CV and cover letter as well, and upon acceptance you must find a professor who you wish to work for.
Interview Questions: What time can I come into TA every week.

title: Special Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: contact by email and then set up a meeting. talked with the administrator who was responsible for all these. Simply talked to the administrator and the assistant administrator and asked questions in English and French, availiability all that, very easy and done.
Interview Questions: why do you think this job is good for you

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The HR lady phone screened me and invited me for an interview about 5 days later. There were two ladies, both of them took notes and asked questions. They asked me questions on my previous work experience and scenario-type questions as well, all tailored to the job description. 

Regarding linguistic requirements, the interview was conducted in English but they did ask me something in French so if you identify that you know French on your resume, expect to be asked a question or two in French! 

The entire interview took about an hour. The HR lady eventually got back to me two days later but no offer was made. Overall, it was a great experience to learn about the interview process for the academic environment.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about your background, related experience and how it contributes to the position. 
What qualities do you like and dislike in your supervisor? 
What are your future goals? And how long do you give yourself to reach it.

title: McGill Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Tutorial Assistant is very nice! You don't need to worry too much about the interview because as soon as you are invited in the first place, all the courses you intend to tutor were approved inclucding the reference from a professor.
Interview Questions: How and where did you hear about our McGill Tutorial Service?

title: Administrative & Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy going. Usually two rounds - 
- 1st round with HR Manager and the Program Manager. There was a small test to evaluate accuracy and knowledge on Excel. Goes to Round 2 if passes all. 
- 2nd round with the Director of Administration and Program Director. Usually will receive an offer letter if qualified
Interview Questions: How will you manage conflicts with Professors?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through a dedicated website, which automatically groups the best candidates into a pool that goes to the professor of the course for final selection. The position is unionized so if you have previous experience bing a TA that is usually very helpful in getting a job. For first time applicants, it helps if you know the professor as they have final say on the recommendation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I've applied do over 150 administrative position at McGill and have landed 5 interviews where i was called back for a second interview for each. At the end of the day no matter how amazing your qualifications, they always choose the internal candidate. All five interviews included 3 interviewers and never ending situational questions.
Interview Questions: Situational questions. Why do you want this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview process for the department of Anatomy. They asked about ten questions in an on-line form about your background and experiences. They also want to know your grade and involvement on campus. They really like students that they are familiar with. I am not sure how carefully they look at the individual questions however because they tend to just hire candidates that they know at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: What was your grade in the course?

title: Master Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Technical talk, research experiences, competition involved, and english ability.
Interview Questions: Your background?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Had the chance to meet the professor for whom I worked during an internship of my MSc. It's always a good idea to know the Prof before actually applying. Once he said that he wanted me to stay, we discussed the research topic in more detail and submitted a formal application through McGill website.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a PhD ?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Online application, quick email and transcript based. References not needed. Position is mostly guaranteed to graduate students. Very simple and straightforward, no tricks. Professor was very helpful and guided my way through.

The position was offered on a college informational postboard. Nothing much was required for application besides being a graduate student, and an A/A- in the course if you took it while at McGill. 

Application was painless and easy. Interview in a week, offer in another week-ish.
Interview Questions: Q: In what ways have you helped reach out and mentor students in your undergrad?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: It focuses mainly on your previous research and on how it matches with the requirements of the project in hand. It is possible that you will be asked to write a proposal also.
Interview Questions: You would be asked to prepare a presentation on your previous works and papers

title: Sustainability Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy-going, about 10 questions with 3 different people in the room. Eager to converse about the mandate, and ready to answer questions about the position. They were willing to give feedback on how this position suited me. Questions were fairly simple - it was easy to give a clear pitch and speak to strengths. They asked some situational questions - about stressful or leadership experience.
Interview Questions: What are some of the personal qualities that someone in this role should have?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. Presentation was required. There were 2 interviews in total. It was a nice opportunity to meet members of the team. A lot of questions on past positions.
Interview Questions: Past positions contributing to the role.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I initially submitted my application in March or April. In August, I was asked to meet with the instructor prior to the beginning of the academic term. I was asked and about my general availability during the semester. Was also asked whether I had prior experience as a TA or tutor.
Interview Questions: A few basic questions about my personal experience with the course as a student (i.e. how well I did)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Practically no interview process; attended a faculty networking speed-dating event.
The professors were very kind and clearly in need of additional research assistants. As I was applying in the Computer Science faculty, where there is a lack of CS researchers, it was likely easy to get a position.
Interview Questions: Experience in developing networked applications.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Discussion over technical details required to solve an engineering problem to be worked upon. Negotiations regarding salary and contract terms. Discussions about my research work at the university. I was appreciated for my thoughts and communication skills along with my technical skills.
Interview Questions: Details about the previous work.

title: Marketing Committee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was incredibly positive. The questions were analytical, not too tough, well-prepared & gave plenty of room for expanding on ideas. The conversation developed naturally, thereby showing that the interviewers were well equipped and knew exactly what they wanted. It was a welcoming experience.
Interview Questions: What new & innovative ideas or plans would you incorporate under the AUS given the role you are applying for and how exactly would you execute them?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from HR a couple of weeks after submitting an application online. Went in for an interview a week later, and had an offer that same day. Overall, was a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience dealing with disgruntled clients?

title: Convocation Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You got interviewed by the head ushers who were extremely kind individuals. They made you feel very comfortable and the environment was generally very casual. They wanted to assess whether you could react well to difficult situations and whether you had a genuine interest in the role. They took on quite a number of employees so the application process was not difficult.
Interview Questions: Team building games and why you applied for such position.

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was very lengthy. I had to go through 2-3 HR rounds and a 3 hr written technical round with 1 technical interview. Late I found out that the interview questions were in no way aligned with the business needs
Interview Questions: 120 questions on PL/SQL, web technologies and Java

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basically Emailed the profs that you are curious about their research, send your cv and once they reply you back get in touch with them in a conversational language. Ask them questions about their research, show your interest on it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why are you interested on my research?

title: Interim Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: A joke since I was and am over-qualified and underpaid. Like vultures they figures they could get someone witha  decent head on their shoulders and pay them less than $10-$15 000 than other universities are paying for similar positions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job!

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
Will be question about the applications area and required skills to develop solutions.
Then the professor will ask about the area of specialty and a couple of challenging problems solved.
Interview Questions: About numerical methods, linear solvers, convergence rates and alike.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth - selected initially from a pool of applicants. Fostering relationships with everyone along the way can be helpful. Being a McGill student was also very helpful in that I knew the department. Networking can be important.
Interview Questions: They asked about my qualifications, my experiences, and why I would be a good fit for the position. Generally standard questions.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall process took about 1.5-2 months. Started with a phone screening interview. Made it through the screening and then scheduled an in-person interview. In person interview was a little over an hour and mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How do you manage expectations on donors?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was first vetted on phone by hr. then, met and was interviewed the director of the institute looking for pm. HR called me following week to say i was top candidate. Asked me to provide references and reached out to them. After not hearing for a week, i calked hr for news. I was told that although i was top choice, the union had not permitted the hire. Budget constraint. I was pretty furious. The process wasted my time and energy, and that of my references. I never expected a Univ HR department to go so far in a recruitment process without a green light. I checked on institute site months later to see if role filled. It never was.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot of questions. 1 hour.

title: Student Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward questions and brief. No technical questions at all. Just questions about schedule and availability. And previous experiences. I particularly interviewed for the Inter Librart Loans Department and the supervisor there is one of the best boss I will ever have in my life.
Interview Questions: If my schedule is free enough to work 15 hours

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: i was working with my supervisor as a phd student. my supervisor needs someone to continue a project and really wants me to help out. meanwhile i am also interested in this project and already having some knowledge about it. so the interview process was very straightforward. we both agreed on the research direction and signed the agreement form.
Interview Questions:
what experiments would you design for this project
how long will you stay

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Lot of technical questions were asked. Then behavioral questions were asked. Lot of focus was on lab safety. Professor gave tour of the lab and asked to identify what could he improve in his lab
Interview Questions: Incase of medical emergency whom do you call, will you use your cell phone or nearest landline

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview just an application online that needs to be filled out in order for the professors to review. Generally speaking if there are openings they will take as many people as they can.
Interview Questions: No Questions

title: Faculty Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: Was first contacted by department coordinator,  2 interviews followed.  One with the department coordinator, the other with the head of the department.  My offer received within one week.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: BI Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process is quite tedious, too many peoples in the interviews room, interview last for 1H30 and a 1 hour academic test immediately after this long interview that test should last for 2 hours as it is almost impossible to complete within one hour

The atmosphere in the interview room where also quite cold
Interview Questions: This is a Bi , and was asked question about network stuff ...

title: Senior Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The first approach was a phone interview that started explaining the fact that although this was a  position of responsibilities the hour wage was quite low. Then we passed to general matters, such as are you currently working, how much time will you need to change jobs, what do you know about McGill and the question of why do you want to work for McGill was posed twice. The second call was to set an interview with HR and the person leaving the job. 
The interview with HR was quite long, almost 1 hour. They pose a lot of questions including: what do you currently do, explain your tasks, what are your strong points, what are your weakness, give an example of how who'll you get a long with a difficult colleague, what computer skills do you have.
The same day they asked me to have an interview right away with the head of the department. Many of the questions already answered were repeated and some new added: why do you want to work for Mc Gill, where do you see yourself in 5 years, why leave your current job were you have been for x number of years.
I got to question back both HR and the head of the department. I emphasized that the first reason to change jobs was to have a better balance between work and family. That seemed to be an issue with the interviewer who expected full availability beyond the regular working hours. I agreed to a certain degree, but not as my current job were extra long hours is the rule and not the rare occasion.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years and after I explained by career ideal, why haven't you contacted directly the person for whom you want to work at McGill?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
I found the Professor whose research interests is same as my M.S thesis, so I send him an email.
I was contact by him in 2 months by phone. He asked what courses I took during my master and some details about my thesis work. After very short discussion, he offered me the position. 
I think the critical point here is that there is very good matching between my thesis and his research.
Interview Questions: None. All questions are very basic, if you really did the work.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: I was looking into professors webpages that interest me, and found an interesting research topic. The professor was looking for graduate student, and posted the requirements. I contacted her by email, and sent my CV. She asked me to present my previous research work via Skype.The interview went well, and I sent my application to the university. Eventually, I got accepted by the department under her supervision.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were relevant to my previous research work.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: - Phone Interview to verify bilingual competencies - In person interview - Offer within 2 weeks of last interview. Overall, the process was easy and the interviewers were nice and approachable. 3 people sat in for the interview. During the phone screen, the main purpose was to determine if you were bilingual. This is very important if you want to work for McGill. Then, they conducted a reference check. And finally, I had my last in person interview.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to work for McGill?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: They don't contact you unless they're interested, and even then sometimes the hiring process can be dragged out over several months. Super standard interviews. Nothing outside of the box. HR is still very old-school when it comes to interviews (for the most part; some departments are more creative). Make sure to do some research into whatever department you're applying into as there are generally a question or two that you'd score better on if you had that additional knowledge.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The professor introduced the project. Then I introduced myself. A research engineer joined in and ask me about my experience. The interview is nice. As I have the experience the prof were looking for, so the interview is comfortable. The prof ia very nice. The interview was focused on the project I will join in and how can I do my contribution.
Interview Questions: Questions on the projects I had been involved in.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: you have to submit your application online and talk to your department secretary. Write down your preferences for types of courses and most of the time, they will accommodate with your preferences.
Interview Questions: there wasn't a formal interview as each registered graduate student is expected to take a position like this. If they think your previous working experience is ok enough, you will get the offer.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a brief telephone interview. Then, there were two proficiency exams. One was to test Microsoft Office skills, the other to test basic reasoning and math. Both were average tests, like the ones found online. The last step was a panel interview with two managers. The questions were standard behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: Name some of your weaknesses

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online - interviewed at McGill University in September 2011. I knocked all the professors in my field of interest. My current supervisor asked me to apply to the university program and then after getting my offer letter my current supervisor enrolled me as his graduate research assistant.
- Interview lasted for about 20 minutes
- Went through resume, discussed relevant experience, and answered fairly standard questions
Interview Questions: I applied online - interviewed at McGill University in January 2011.

title: Animal Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions: -kind of sketchy process (no real interview, just checked 1 reference)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Surveying Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process is very simple. There is no actual 'interview' you will  just fill out a form, with some questions regarding your previous experience with surveying (mostly having taken the course the year earlier.) If you have done well enough in the course you will probably get the job.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience in surveying?

title: Timetable and Scheduling Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the office manager and HR personal. They ask you questions on your CV - the usual. They aren't very tough questions, they just want to make sure you can communicate clearly, stay on top of things and can pay attention to detail (very important!).  The atmosphere during the interview was pretty relaxed.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you worked under pressure

title: Accounts Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: It was rather simply. I was referred by an employee who asked me to come in for a sit down with her boss. It was really very general and informal. Nothing in particular to prepare for. Then I spoke to the person I would be working with on the same day in a separate office. Was a breeze just conversational. The people in general were very nice but the job was actually underwhelming given I had higher expectations.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Through referral and previous web management experience; Know Drupal (CMS used by McGill) and you'll be useful to A LOT of professors/departments who need their sites updated
Interview Questions: Nothing particular; If you have previous experience working with Drupal (CMS) or have built websites before, show your work and you'll be competitive (there are a lot of opportunities to manage sites at this institution)

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Did not require an interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor suggested I apply for the position so I submitted my CV and cover letter. I was emailed for an interview shortly after. The interview was with the two employers. Questions varied from research experience to my research interests to creative initiatives I would take.
Interview Questions: Specific questions regarding what creative directions/initiatives I would take in regards to their research area. I was sent some of the group's articles in advance to familiarize myself with their work.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: You have to convince the prof about your capabilities. Since there is always the funding problem it is highly recommended to get in touch with some local industries who are willing to invest on research beforehand.
Interview Questions: The questions are mainly about your background and how does it match the requirements of the specific team.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a on site interview. A presentation was made. Talked with supervisor. Chatted with staffs and students about their research topics. Because I read their papers before the interview, I knew their research already. I had dinner with staffs and students at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: Technical questions related to the research problems

title: Correspondence Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University
Interview Descriptions:
-Contacted for an interview within a few weeks of applying through McGill work study
-Interviewed by two interviewers - both were very kind and helped me feel comfortable throughout the entire process
- Interview lasted for about 20 minutes 
- Went through resume, discussed relevant experience, and answered fairly standard behavioural questions 
- Job offered on the same day of the interview
Interview Questions:
What are the procedures you take to ensure accuracy in your work? 
How do you handle mistakes?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
What was the job title or position?
Please tell us about the recruitment and interview process.
Please share the most difficult or unexpected question that you were asked in this interview.
Please let us know the outcome of this interview
Please let us know the overall experience of this interview

What was the job title or position?
Please tell us about the recruitment and interview process.
Please share the most difficult or unexpected question that you were asked in this interview.
Please let us know the outcome of this interview
Please let us know the overall experience of this interview
Interview Questions: asked the questions about your cv?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted the application online, then met with HR for a brief interview with the project head. The interview lasted about an hour and consisted only of basic questions. I was required to start basic training for the job before the official hire date, and then was subsequently not paid for that time.
Interview Questions: What professional experience do you bring to this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was not a difficult one. It was pretty much easier if you apply for a position based on your expertise.I liked the way the questions were posed and the interviewer was keen on testing my basics on the position I had applied for.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2012
