Interview Descriptions: contact a professor on the phone, and asked me about my background and associated modeling skills, very causal, and brought me to a lunch.
Interview Questions: not a difficult question

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: I e-mailed a professor to ask for a position in her lab, we discussed my transcript and my CV and she said she would take me on as a volunteer.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to animate?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fast and easy? It certainly helped that my McGill PI and me were alumni from the same University. Had one in person interview and was all set to start, the only problem was that I had to wait for my fellowship application to go through.
Interview Questions: What have you done before? Why McGill? Why a new research topic?

title: Faculty Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had been working as a teaching assistant for the course for almost 4 years. One year, the faculty needed sometime to teach the course (serve as a faculty lecturer), so i was shortlisted among the possible candidates, by the senior professors on the department. The professor who originally used to teach the course, invited me to his office and conducted an interview. After a few days, i got an official offer to teach the course, which i accepted.
Interview Questions: How much and why am i interested in teaching a course, and why that course in particular.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the investigator I worked for via email. A meeting was scheduled in his office. We just sat down and discussed some of my research experience and scientific interests. He talked about the projects going on in the lab and some of the findings that they've published recently. Very informal process.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy about research?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Well I knew someone who was doing postdoc. I got asked a couple of questions and got in.
Interview Questions: Nothing to be honest.

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Mostly questions from the Resume. They asked mostly about the previous experiences and how it is relevant for the current position I was applying for. They explained the job and how my role will fit into the matrix organization.
Interview Questions: Explain the previous experiences?

title: Homecoming Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Just ask expected questions like walk me through your CV. Really look for students willing to show commitment for at least the end of homecoming season and with basic data computer skills.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question would be to present your own idea on how to change homecoming around

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I needed to submit an application for the job. After my references were checked, I was alerted that I had received an interview. I met first with the office which was looking to hire me. I was able to ask questions about the position and get a feel for what they were looking for. In the final round, I met with the specific researcher who I was going to be working under. I feel like his approval was the most important.
Interview Questions: How will the place you grew up in help you with succeeding at this job?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue, QC) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the supervisor. Had the experience with identifying plants, therefore I got the job.
Interview Questions: What other experience do you have working in the field?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a few profs. There were varying degrees of "intensity", but the final interview from which I landed my position was very informal. A quick half hour chat and then the offer.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with coding?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: About an hour with the Pi, lab tour then 30 mins each with about 6-8 people with a break for lunch. All day interview, you give a presentation in the beginning based on your former research
Interview Questions: WHY do you want to work here!!!

title: Junior IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submit an online application as well as a hard copy. You will be called a towards the end of the semester for an interview. It's a one round interview.
Interview Questions: It's mostly gonna be a behavioural question, and some technical questions.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are based on your past research and depend on the professor and lab. Usually they want to know your background, interest and attitude. With a right mind set for research and knowing the project will be useful in the interview. Prepare with the description, lab or professors background and on going projects
Interview Questions: What is your research goals?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, done by different supervisors. Pretty standard questions ranging from how much you know about the university, why you want to be a tour guide, etc. Felt that they were trying to gauge one's personality more than anything, as that is half the job.
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions, mostly standard.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: try to find the best professionnal researcher possible in the biology fieald of BRCA1, the breast cancer diagnostic panel interview. Keratins (Ks), the intermediate filament (IF) proteins of epithelial cells, constitute the largest and most diversified family of cytoskeletal proteins, which are grouped into type I (K9-28) and type II (K1-K8 and K71-K80) subfamilies
Interview Questions: what is your experiment with PCR

title: Student Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Everything was easy, just asked general questions, want to see if you know anything about serving food and stuff.
Interview Questions: They asked basic questions nothing unexpected you basically just need to know someone working there who is in good terms with the boss to get an interview and a job.

title: Academic Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: As with most jobs at McGill, I was told about it by a friend who was a friend of the person hiring.  If you don't know someone at McGill, you have little chance of actually getting a job there.  The interview was collegial and the questions were out of a textbook.  At one point they asked me about an impossible situation to resolve and simply told them that the situation was impossible to resolve with an outcome that would satisfy the person I was serving and I would have to accept that.  They seemed satisfied with my lack of personal investment in perfection.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected and nothing anyone with a brain couldn't answer.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I read publications of the PI and researched their Lab techniques. I reviewed my previous research experience. I tried to be honest and natural. I was mostly asked about my previous research experience.
i tried to give arguments for why I chose him to be as my potential supervisor and reveieled a big interest in his work
Interview Questions: what are the research techniques that  I know

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: they post the job openning online, I saw it and sent my cv. it was reviewed by a secretary I guess. And then I got a phone interview. At last, they ask me to the lab and I talk 1:1 vs the PI. After 1 week, I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Have you done xxx (the tech they required) before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I knocked all the professors in my field of interest, 2/3 of them were interested. My current supervisor asked me to apply to the university program and then after getting my offer letter my current supervisor enrolled me as his graduate research assistant
Interview Questions: none

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: By email to professors with interested field, and make sure of the follow up.
Interview Questions: I was not challenged by any difficult or unexpected questions

title: Programmer-Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very long process, slow bureaucracy.  As an internal candidate, I found the questions particularly difficult and set to trip me up.  This is unfortunate since I possess many of the skills required.  Interview conducted by HR director, IT director and an analyst.  I am not counting on getting this position but will definitely try again.  My advice is to be patient and not count the days...
Interview Questions: Tell us how you have been in a situation of conflict with other team members and how you resolved it. Tell us of a time you failed.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: A professor already knew my field of expertise and offered me a position on one of his projects. I thought about it a week or so and accepted the offer. I did not really go through an interview, it was quite informal and easy to manage.
Interview Questions: When can you start

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was a summer position at University's accounting department. I applied through work-study website. Few days after recruiter contacted me for personal interview. On the date of the interview, there were two female recruiters, one asked questions, one took notes. The interview is about an hour long, with comprehensive questions ranging from technical to behavioral. Overall, it's not a difficult process, but if you don't have much interview experience, I sugguest you prepare the basic behavioral questions found on internet, then listen carefully to every question they asked. Some questions may seems irrelevant but your answer will show whether you fit the position or not.
Interview Questions: Describe the most tedious task you have ever done.

title: Floor Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, but this is not your traditional application. You should be prepared to write a funny, engaging, and interesting essay that will make the committee want to meet you. If you come off as at all dull or boring, you won't be interviewed, simple as that. Once the interview took place, it was quite nerve wracking as there were about 8 people interviewing me. Questions varied from those that more legitimately questioned your aptitude for the job, others were trying to find out about personality, sense of humour, etc. Be prepared to be yourself! It would also help to talk to an existing floor fellow in person to understand more about what kind of answers you should be giving.
Interview Questions: What sorts of things do you find funny?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions:
get contacted with the professor via e-mail.
we made an appointment to meet at one morning 10am.
I went there and knocked at his door. He was not there, I waited outside of the door for 10 minutes. 
He came back. We talked for 30 minutes. Then, he showed me the lab.
Interview Questions: what's your current situation

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McGill University (Montreal, QC) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Typical process for getting a PhD position:
- Contacted potential supervisor to see if they were taking on students.
- Met with potential supervisor to see if I was good fit and discussed potential projects and funding. Interview was very informal.
- Applied to McGill's Department of Graduate studies via online admissions and submitted necessary transcripts and reference letters.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my research program?
